greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle of number of partitions that fit in an n X n box (but not in an (n-1) X (n-1) box) with Durfee square k.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for the first 50 rows, flattened
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Durfee Square.
mathematica: Table[Binomial[n, k]^2 - Binomial[n - 1, k], {n, 1, 10}, {k, 1, n}] // Flatten (* _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 20 2017 *)
program: (PARI) for(n=1,10, for(k=0,n, print1(binomial(n,k)^2 - binomial(n-1,k)^2, ", "))) \\ _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 20 2017
results.author: _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Feb 20 2006
